Executive Summary

This Risk Management Plan (RMP) updates the City of Weslaco Wastewater Treatment Plant from a Prevention Program 2 to a Prevention Program 3 and includes the required elements of Process Safety Management (PSM). Operations Management International, Inc. (OMI), a private contractor, operates the plant. A wastewater treatment plant operated by a private contractor is subject to Prevention Program 3, which encompasses the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM standards. The contents of this RMP and PSM document the Weslaco Wastewater Treatment Plant?s compliance with the Clean Air Act Section 112 (r)(7), 40 CFR 68, and 29 CFR 1910.119 for the protection of employees, the public and the environment.

This Risk Management Plan has been updated to include Process Safety Management. This involved the addition of sections on:
?    Process Hazard Analysis 
?    Management of Change 
?    Pre-Startup Review
?    Employee Participation Plans 
?    Hot Work Permits 
?    Contractors

The act of updating and resubmitting the RMP also involved a review or revision of the following:
?    operating procedures
?    training programs
?    maintenance procedures
?    equipment inspection
?    Emergency Response Plan
?    Emergency Response Training

The City of Weslaco Wastewater Treatment Plant accidental release prevention policy integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. The Weslaco emergency response policy involves the preparation of a response plan tailored to each facility and to the emergency response services available in the community. The policy adheres to Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Prevention Program procedures where applicable, and complies with EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.
